title: 104_s2144
content:
The "Foreign Bank Enforcement Act of 1996" may be cited as the short title. Unauthorized participation by convicted persons is addressed in the Act. The Federal Deposit Insurance Act is amended to define the term 'appropriate Federal banking authority' as either the Corporation or the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, depending on the type of institution. The term 'insured depository institution' includes various types of financial institutions regulated by different federal agencies such as the Federal Reserve, the Comptroller of the Currency, and the Office of Thrift Supervision. The term 'insured depository institution' includes various types of financial institutions regulated by federal agencies such as the Federal Reserve, the Comptroller of the Currency, and the Office of Thrift Supervision, under specific sections. SEC. 3. REMOVAL ACTIONS AGAINST PERSONS CONVICTED OF FELONIES. Amends Section 8(i)(3) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act to include orders pursuant to subsection (g) and references to notices and orders. SEC. 4. INTERNATIONAL COOPERATION. Section 15 of the International Banking Act of 1978 is amended to include new subsections regarding the disclosure of information obtained from foreign supervisors by U.S. banking agencies. The agencies are not required to disclose such information if the foreign supervisor has determined that public disclosure would violate their laws, and the information is obtained through specified procedures. The International Banking Act of 1978 is amended to allow U.S. banking agencies to withhold information obtained from foreign supervisors if public disclosure would violate foreign laws. The agencies can use authorized procedures or a memorandum of understanding for enforcement. This subsection is considered a statute under title 5, United States Code. The provision does not authorize agencies to withhold information from Congress or prevent compliance with court orders. SEC. 5. TERMINATION OF FOREIGN BANK OFFICES IN THE UNITED STATES.

Section 7(e) of the International Banking Act of 1978 is amended to include provisions for termination orders issued by the Board or the Comptroller. These orders may contain terms and conditions deemed appropriate to carry out this subsection.

SEC. 6. DISCLOSURE OF CERTAIN MATTERS OCCURRING BEFORE GRAND JURY.

Section 3322(b) of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include disclosure requirements for matters occurring before a grand jury involving financial institutions.
